question.title: Package Doesn't Exist Error in VS Code Java
question.body:
I installed the Java and Java Extension Pack extensions and followed the directions to install an Eclipse Temurin JDK.

I then copied a project I was working on from another PC (also in VS Code), on which I had no problems, to this one.

I now have this error on an import: package net.miginfocom does not exist, which doesn't make any sense to me because I have the .jar that contains the class in my project.

Here's the full error (using CodeRunner):

[Running] cd "c:\Users\blah\Java\Time Management Program\src\" && javac StartProgram.java && java StartProgram
StartProgram.java:3: error: package net.miginfocom does not exist
import net.miginfocom.*;
^
StartProgram.java:162: error: cannot find symbol
    JPanel dropArea = new JPanel(new MigLayout(
                                     ^
  symbol:   class MigLayout
  location: class StartProgram
.\CalendarEventButton.java:3: error: package net.miginfocom.swing does not exist
import net.miginfocom.swing.MigLayout;
                           ^
.\CalendarEventButton.java:15: error: cannot find symbol
    panel = new JPanel(new MigLayout(
                           ^
  symbol:   class MigLayout
  location: class CalendarEventButton
Note: StartProgram.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
4 errors

Though if I try to run the main from the file itself I get different errors, this time for each custom class I made:

C:\Users\blah\Programming\Java\Time Management Program\src\StartProgram.java:280: error: cannot find symbol
public CalendarEvent createNewEvent(){
^
symbol:   class CalendarEvent
location: class StartProgram
C:\Users\blah\Programming\Java\Time Management Program\src\StartProgram.java:285: error: cannot find symbol
public CalendarEvent createNewEvent(LocalDate date, LocalTime time, CalendarEventSettings settings){
^
symbol:   class CalendarEventSettings
location: class StartProgram
//more like this

The Swing components of MigLayout, the thing I'm trying to import, need two .jar files, one called "core" and one called "swing". I have both in my project and they are both referenced as libraries in my settings.json:

{
  "java.project.sourcePaths": [ "src" ],
  "java.project.referencedLibraries": [
      "lib/miglayout-core-4.3-20121116.151612-3.jar",
      "lib/miglayout-swing-4.3-20121116.151626-3.jar" 
    ]
}

Here is my project structure

I followed the instructions of ChatGPT and somehow manually got it to compile and run without any errors, which makes me even more confused.

question_comments.body: Here is a Maven example you can use. Just unzip it into your project root. It uses their Example01 app. Use the "Maven for Java" extension in vsc

Don't use wildcard imports: it's ambiguous and provides insufficient info. Your 'IDE' will sort out your imports for you (Shift-Alt-O). You need probably just import net.miginfocom.swing.MigLayout plus the individual Swing imports. I would recommend you use Maven with VSC then you shouldn't have dependency/import problems
By the way: Oracle Java Platform Extension for Visual Studio Code

In a different IDE, you'd have to tell the IDE to use an external library, which would be the Jar file with net.miginfocom . The settings.json might be something specific to the previous IDE, so it might not work in the current one. Look about, see if you can find instruction for importing a "library" for your current IDE, try those directions to see if it helps.
